text:
News Releases

Payroll employment increases by 315,000 in August; unemployment rate rises to 3.7% Total nonfarm payroll employment increased by 315,000 in August, and the unemployment rate rose to 3.7 percent. Notable job gains occurred in professional and business services, health care, and retail trade.

| | | |

Real average hourly earnings for all employees increase 0.2% in August Real average hourly earnings for all employees increased 0.2 percent in August, seasonally adjusted. Average hourly earnings increased 0.3 percent, and CPI-U increased 0.1 percent. Real average weekly earnings decreased 0.1 percent.

| |

Next Release

The Employment Situation for September 2022 is scheduled to be released on October 7, 2022, at 8:30 A.M. Eastern Time.

Real Earnings for September 2022 is scheduled to be released on October 13, 2022, at 8:30 A.M. Eastern Time.
